title: How to Teach Your Kids About Money Without the Lecture
subtitle: Engage your children in financial discussions through practical experiences and normalized conversations.
content:
How to Teach Your Kids About Money Without the Lecture

I'm Tyler, a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. If any of this is helpful, check out my new podcast by clicking the link in my bio.

1. Show Them, Don't Tell Them

Kids learn spending habits early by watching how you tip, save, and swipe. Don’t forget, those comments you’re making at the dinner table when they’re young? They hear that!

2. Give Them Real Money to Manage

A $50 allowance gives them more than 50 lectures on compound interest. Let them handle real money to learn its value and how to manage it wisely.

3. Involve Them in Financial Conversations

Involve them early in your financial conversations. Age-appropriate transparency turns money from taboo into something normal. We all know how much we need to normalize talking about money.

Conclusion

If any of this is helpful, go talk to your kids about money!
